borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)

The scale, siting and design of the proposed front extension are considered to unduly dominate the dwellinghouse, extending beyond the width of the original front elevation of the dwellinghouse. As such, the proposed development is considered to be harmful to the appearance of the house and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)

- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)

- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)

<div>The applicant has failed to present plans which accurately portray&nbsp;the&nbsp;development present at the application site, or the development hereby proposed. Specifically the plans fail to demonstrate the existing conservatory and canopy that have been constructed at the rear of the site, or the existing roof form.&nbsp; Additionally, the proposed development is not consistently represented across the proposed floorplans, block plan or elevations, which demonstrate different measurements and positioning of the proposed development. As such, it cannot be demonstrated or determined that the proposed development would be supported by the Development Plan.</div><div><br></div><div>As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;</span>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 14.98px;">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 14.98px;">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;</span>The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p></div>
description: Construction of a single storey front extension and the construction of a two storey side and rear extension
